title: Minidoka National Historic Site: Education
body: Minidoka Relocation Center: A Site of Conscience Minidoka NHS is a valuable source of information and materials about the internment and incarceration experience of the Nikkei and the local community, as well as civil and constitutional rights, racism, discrimination in the United States, and the fragility of democracy in times of crisis. We are endeavoring to help teachers educate their students about this complex and difficult story.                 Educational Curriculum Materials Minidoka NHS teamed up with Densho, the Japanese American Legacy Project, to develop a useable and valuable curriculum to help explore this subject. Read More        Take a field trip to the actual site! Nothing helps students better connect with the past as visiting the actual place where it happened.  It can help you imagine and understand.
